Posts.Content: Guitargal wrote: Hi, I've had some swelling in my breast ever since my surgery in Feb. this year, but recently its gotten very bad.  I went for an ultrasound yesterday and discovered it's not fluid but a semi-solid area.  They did a biopsy, but I'll have to wait for 8-10 for pathology.  Is it cancer, inflammed tissue, infection?  can anyone help? stage 2, grade 3, 1/8 nodes positive ductial carcinoma Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Panicking! Need to know if this has happened to anyone Guitargal bermudagem

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2008 04:30PM Guitargal wrote: it'd be so nice to hear, oh, that happened to me, it was this and this is what they did to treat it.....

Posts.Content: Jun 19, 2008 04:41PM Guitargal wrote: Thanks so much.  I hope to hear from Binney.  Every Dr I talk to says wait for the path report, but I need to hear what it could be. Its very swollen, tender and warm to the touch.  I just finished chemo 2 weeks ago...
Posts.Title: Panicking! Need to know if this has happened to anyone Guitargal bermudagem

Posts.Content: Jun 25, 2008 01:33PM Guitargal wrote: Well, the path results came back and unfortunately it is cancer, so I'm faced with a full masectomy.   If anyone ever experiences a hematoma post surgery, please be very careful.  I feel that if I'd had the hematoma address, I would be in this position, and they may have been able to treat this differently, or at least sooner.
